DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Diagnostic Procedure Absent Result Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the specified free-text field related to lack of diagnostic result  through a physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Diagnostic Procedure Absent Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to lack of diagnostic result  through a physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Diagnostic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
